title: Peter Hurley's ProBoard Backdrop Setup
summary: Photographer Peter Hurley demonstrates his studio setup using the ProBoard as a portable white backdrop. He explains how to mount it using stands and clamps, and how to light it effectively to hide surface imperfections by blowing out the background.

steps.action: Announcement of a live Google Hangout event involving a haircut.
Introduction of the ProBoard used as a white backdrop.
Demonstration of the mounting system using two stands and clamps.
Lighting the backdrop using continuous lights.
Explanation of how overexposing the background hides scratches and reflections.
Overview of the complete studio lighting and backdrop configuration.

key_takeaways: Overexposing a white background helps eliminate visible scratches and imperfections.
The ProBoard serves as a portable and flexible white backdrop solution.
Standard grip equipment like Avenger stands and clamps can be used to mount the board vertically.
